alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 05 at 2:27AM EDT until July 05 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR NORTHWESTERN CHEROKEE COUNTY... At 227 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen during the past three hours. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area during the next hour. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Unaka and Hiawasse Dam. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
